title: 112_hr2867
content: The Act is titled the "United States Commission on International Religious Freedom Reform and Reauthorization Act of 2011." It establishes that each member of the Commission shall serve a 2-year term and not more than 2 terms. The Commission members serve a 2-year term and cannot exceed 2 terms. If a member completes 2 full terms, their term ends 90 days later. No member can serve beyond their term expiration. The Commission members serve 2-year terms and are limited to 2 terms. If a member attends less than 75% of meetings during a term, they are ineligible for reappointment. The International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 limits Commission members to two 2-year terms and prohibits reappointment if attendance falls below 75%. Additionally, members cannot serve as Chair for a second consecutive term. Federal travel regulations now apply to Commission members. Members of the Commission are now subject to Federal Travel Regulation and Department of State Standardized Regulations governing authorized travel at government expense. Regulations govern authorized travel at government expense, including mode of travel, lodging, per diem expenditures, reimbursement payments, and expense reporting. SEC. 3. APPLICATION OF ANTIDISCRIMINATION LAWS. Amendment to International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 to include application of antidiscrimination laws for employment, family and medical leave, fair labor standards, and employee polygraph. The curr_chunk discusses the application of antidiscrimination laws in various aspects of employment, including family and medical leave, fair labor standards, employee protections, veterans' employment, disabilities, occupational safety, and more. The Commission employees are to be treated as Senate or House employees for pay purposes. Pending claims can still be maintained. SEC. 4. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Section 207(a) of the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 is amended to allocate funds for fiscal years 2012 through 2014. SEC. 5. STANDARDS OF CONDUCT AND DISCLOSURE. Amendments to increase financial disclosure requirements and change department name. SEC. 6. TERMINATION. Details on the termination clause of the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998. SEC. 6. TERMINATION. Section 209 of the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 is amended to change the termination date to September 30, 2014. SEC. 7. REPORT ON EFFECTIVENESS OF PROGRAMS TO PROMOTE RELIGIOUS FREEDOM. The Comptroller General of the United States will submit a report on the implementation of this Act and its amendments within 1 year of enactment. The Comptroller General of the United States will submit a report on the effectiveness of US Government programs promoting international religious freedom within 1 year of the Act's enactment, consulting with congressional committees and organizations. The report will review the effectiveness of US Government programs promoting international religious freedom, assess the Office on International Religious Freedom, and examine the role of the Ambassador at Large for International Religious Freedom. The report will review the effectiveness of US Government programs promoting international religious freedom, assess the Office on International Religious Freedom, and examine the role of the Ambassador at Large for International Religious Freedom, as well as the goals and objectives of the United States Commission on International Religious Freedom. The report will assess the goals and objectives of the United States Commission on International Religious Freedom, compare its structure to other advisory commissions, and review the relationship between the Ambassador at Large for International Religious Freedom and the United States. The curr_chunk discusses the review of advisory commissions, including the relationship between the Ambassador at Large for International Religious Freedom and the United States Commission on International Religious Freedom. It also mentions possible reforms to improve their ability to reach goals and objectives. The term "appropriate congressional committees" is defined in this section. The curr_chunk discusses the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
